title: Felicity Huffman spotted in her prison jumpsuit during family visiting day as she starts sentence
text:
In addition to her green prison uniform, she wore glasses, a wristwatch and black Under Armour sneakers

Huffman appeared to be smiling and was unaccompanied as she walked across the exterior prison grounds

Felicity Huffman is seen here in new pictures wearing a green jumpsuit and a white hat as she goes out to meet her husband, William H. Macy, and daughter, Sophia, during family visiting day Saturday

Advertisement

Felicity Huffman was spotted wearing her green jumpsuit during Saturday's family visiting day at California's FCI Dublin, as she walked outside to greet her husband, William H. Macy, and daughter, Sophia, who had gone to the prison to see her.

New pictures show Huffman wearing a dark green two-piece prison uniform, with her hair tucked up under a white hat, as she exits the prison alone to meet up with family who had traveled to Dublin, California, see her.

Huffman, who was smiling and did not seem to be accompanied by any guards, completed her outfit with black and white Under Armour sneakers, a black wristwatch and glasses.

Felicity Huffman is seen here in new pictures wearing a green jumpsuit and a white hat as she exits California's FCI Dublin to meet her husband and daughter during the prison's family visiting day Saturday

Huffman's husband, William H. Macy (right), and daughter, Sophia (left), were spotted arriving at FCI Dublin Saturday

Huffman reported to the Federal Correctional Institution - the minimum-security women's prison known to locals as 'Club Fed' - in Dublin, California, on Tuesday.

She got caught up in the college admissions scandal after she was found to have paid admissions consultant Rick Singer $15,000 to forge SAT answers for her now 19-year-old daughter, Sophia.

Huffman pleaded guilty to conspiracy to commit mail fraud in the scheme and was sentenced to 14 days behind bars.

While she was sentenced to 14 days, jail records obtained by TMZ indicated that she will be released after 13 days on October 27.

Huffman's prison wardrobe consisted of a matching green shirt and pants, Under Armour sneakers, white hat, glasses and a black wristwatch. She appeared to be unaccompanied as she walked outside the prison

Huffman was seen walking outdoors in her prison wardrobe with her hair tucked up under her cap on Saturday

Huffman is seen here in the doorway of FCI Dublin on Saturday. She smiled as she spoke with a prison guard

Huffman appeared to be smiling as she exited the minimum-security women's prison which is known to locals as 'Club Fed'

Huffman appeared to be unaccompanied and in relatively good spirits as she walked around outside the prison grounds

Sophia and Macy are seen here walking through FCI Dublin's parking lot Saturday. Huffman had asked that she be allowed to serve her sentence at the prison because it's the closest federal prison to her home in Los Angeles

Macy was dressed casually in jeans, blazer, sneakers and a baseball cap when he went to the prison to visit his wife

Huffman (center) is seen here, with husband, William H. Macy, on September 13 as she left the Boston courthouse where she received her 14-day sentence after pleading guilty to conspiracy to commit mail fraud in the college admission scandal

She was already credited with one day after she was in custody for a few hours following her arrest earlier this year.

Although FCI Dublin has a reputation as one of America's cushiest lock-ups, but it's still a far cry from her sprawling Los Angeles mansion.

A photograph of one of the cells shows the tight quarters with barely any floor space between three beds dressed in white sheets and a small sink tucked right by the door.

Huffman's lawyers had asked Judge Indira Talwani to recommend that she be allowed to serve her sentence in Dublin because it's the closest federal prison to her home in Los Angeles.

The decision to place her there was ultimately made by the Federal Bureau of Prisons.

The exterior of FCI Dublin, the minimum-security women's prison known to locals as 'Club Fed,' where Huffman will live until her sentence is up on October 27. She was credited one day after she was in custody for a few hours following her arrest

Sophia, 19, was spotted at an unidentified school campus in Los Angeles on Wednesday, wearing a Fordham University sweater.

It is unclear what university Sophia will attend but the family have spoken previously of her desire to act. Her Hollywood A-list parents supported her at her graduation the LA County High School for the Arts in June.

Entertainment Tonight reported at the time that Sophia Grace was going to take a break and not enroll in college immediately in the wake of her mother's scandal.
description: Felicity Huffman was seen Saturday wearing her green prison jumpsuit and a white hat as she goes out to meet her relatives during family visiting day at California's minimum security FCI Dublin.
